intro: Psychotria lucida, commonly known as the "Bitterleaf" or "Cupuaçu" in some regions, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in rainforests and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine. The fruit of Psychotria lucida is edible and has a unique, slightly bitter flavor.
